elements.title: flag family (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that most national flags belong to a flag family with similar designs?

elements.title: Lebon Patisserie & Café (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the Lebon Patisserie & Café in Istanbul closed in 2022, after 212 years of business, due to the high increase of monthly rent?

elements.title: Albert Sack (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Albert Sack wrote the "bible" for a generation of weekend antique furniture buyers?

elements.title: Tahiti Trot (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Dmitri Shostakovich denounced his own Tahiti Trot, an orchestral arrangement of "Tea for Two", as a political blunder?

elements.title: Beryl Benacerraf (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Beryl Benacerraf, pioneer of the nuchal scan, wrote that dyslexia caused her to live in a world of images where "anomalies jump out at me like a neon sign"?

elements.title: dolphin-assisted therapy (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that one of the first researchers to propose dolphin-assisted therapy for humans later renounced it?

elements.title: rescue 92 men held prisoner at a remote desert oasis (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that in March 1916 the Duke of Westminster led a group of armoured cars on a 250-mile (400 km) round trip to rescue 92 men held prisoner at a remote desert oasis?

elements.title: anyone who has ever worn a polo shirt around McVay is now an NFL head coach (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the success of Los Angeles Rams coach Sean McVay led sportswriter Bill Barnwell to quip that "anyone who has ever worn a polo shirt around McVay is now an NFL head coach"?
